Issues.Title: Inline style grid-column-start/grid-column-end rounds any value greater than 1000 to 1000 (1021 will be 1000)
Issues.Body:
### Version

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/y7af5dsu/](https://jsfiddle.net/y7af5dsu/)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Set inline style="grid-column-end: 1021".

Issues.Title: VUE-COMPOSITION-API: why does ref not feel reactive on contenteditable, especially on this case
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/zealous-ardinghelli-b05ph](https://codesandbox.io/s/zealous-ardinghelli-b05ph)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to: https://codesandbox.io/s/zealous-ardinghelli-b05ph
2. Place cursor to text
3. Click the “INSERT IMAGE BETWEEN TEXT” button
4. Pay attention to the shown ref() below the button

### What is expected?
the ref() can “catch up” the inserted image to the text.

### What is actually happening?
the ref() can’t “catch up” the inserted image to the text.

---
Been asking on this: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66708115/vue-composition-api-why-does-ref-not-feel-reactive-on-contenteditable and this: https://forum.vuejs.org/t/vue-composition-api-why-does-ref-not-feel-reactive-on-contenteditable/113409
but no answer.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VUE-COMPOSITION-API: why does ref not feel reactive on contenteditable, especially on this case" (#11970)

Issues.Title: v-text evaluates HTML entities hard-coded strings
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/m297ke3y/9/](https://jsfiddle.net/m297ke3y/9/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add a v-text directive to any tag
2. Hardcode a string into it (i.e `'<h1>This & That</h1>'`)

### What is expected?
HTML entities should not be evaluated in the hard-coded string, they should be written out as they are.

### What is actually happening?
HTML entities in the string are converted to their equivalent symbols.

---
I'm not sure if this is intended behaviour, but it seems odd that the two behaviours in my jsfiddle should differ.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "v-text evaluates HTML entities hard-coded strings" (#11969)

Issues.Title: Override of the renderStyle and renderResourcehints during manual asset injection
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/sns45/esm-issue](https://github.com/sns45/esm-issue)







### Steps to reproduce
Create SSR page using:
https://ssr.vuejs.org/guide/build-config.html#manual-asset-injection

or clone the repro:
npm install
npm run build
npm run start


### What is expected?
We should be allowed to override these `renderResourceHints()` and `renderStyles()` functions which is used in `index.template.html`.

### What is actually happening?
Cannot override or customize `renderResourceHints()` and `renderStyles()` functions. 

---
I am looking to override `renderResourceHints()` and `renderStyles()` functions so I can inline one of the critical css in the HTML using `<style></style>` tag. From `asyncData()`, I should be allowed to fine tune what resources should be preloaded or not preloaded based on the store data.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Override of the renderStyle and renderResourcehints during manual asset injection" (#11960)

Issues.Title: fix(v-model): ensure v-model listener trigger before listener with modifier(fix #11925)
Issues.Body:
This reverts commit 62405aa9035d5f547c0440263f16f21c1325f100.

Because after v2.6.0, nextTick always use microtask.
There will be an update between 2 listener and block the v-model listener to update.
We need to ensure the listener of v-model is triggered before listener with modifier to fix #11925.

Issues.Title: Passing dynamic values into subcomponents will not render correctly!
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link [https://codesandbox.io/s/fervent-austin-9zre8?file=/src/components/HelloWorld.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/fervent-austin-9zre8?file=/src/components/HelloWorld.vue) ### Steps to reproduce I tried to write it according to the official document example, but when the dynamic attribute value is passed in, it will be rendered to the tag attribute of the subcomponent. I don't know what's wrong? This is the last example of the rendering list in the official document. The code is as follows: @/components/HelloWorld.vue ```
``` @/components/TodoItems.vue ``` ``` I review the DOM element and the rendering results are: ```
``` As you can see, the is property will render the todoitems component correctly, but the incoming text property will display correctly in the Li tag, not in the text! And the following error occurred in the console: > Property or method "text" is not defined on the instance but referenced during render. Make sure that this property is reactive, either in the data option, or for class-based components, by initializing the property. See: https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/reactivity.html#Declaring-Reactive-Properties. found in ---> at src/components/TodoItems.vue at src/components/HelloWorld.vue at src/views/Home.vue at src/App.vue When I test passing in attributes to other child components in other parent components, it will render correctly! But in this case, I don't know why? Miraculously, there is no problem in using JS. Please refer to the sandbox address I created When writing with TS, it is not expected. ### What is expected? The text attribute passed in can be correctly rendered under the Li tag ### What is actually happening? In this example, the rendering is not correct, even if the component is used instead of the is attribute, the rendering result is the same --- Looking forward to the solution
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Passing dynamic values into subcomponents will not render correctly!" (#11950)

Issues.Title: build(deps): bump handlebars from 4.4.3 to 4.7.7
Issues.Body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.4.3 to 4.7.7.
Changelog

Sourced from handlebars's changelog.

v4.7.7 - February 15th, 2021

  • fix weird error in integration tests - eb860c0
  • fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736) - b6d3de7
  • fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736) - f058970
  • refactor: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683) - 77825f8
  • chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13 - 3789a30

(POSSIBLY) BREAKING CHANGES:

  • the changes from version 4.6.0 now also apply in when using the compile-option "strict: true". Access to prototype properties is forbidden completely by default, specific properties or methods can be allowed via runtime-options. See #1633 for details. If you are using Handlebars as documented, you should not be accessing prototype properties from your template anyway, so the changes should not be a problem for you. Only the use of undocumented features can break your build.

That is why we only bump the patch version despite mentioning breaking changes.

Commits

v4.7.6 - April 3rd, 2020

Chore/Housekeeping:

  • #1672 - Switch cmd parser to latest minimist (@​dougwilson

Compatibility notes:

  • Restored Node.js compatibility

Commits

v4.7.5 - April 2nd, 2020

Chore/Housekeeping:

  • Node.js version support has been changed to v6+ Reverted in 4.7.6

Compatibility notes:

  • Node.js < v6 is no longer supported Reverted in 4.7.6

Commits

v4.7.4 - April 1st, 2020

Chore/Housekeeping:

  • #1666 - Replaced minimist with yargs for handlebars CLI (@​aorinevo, @​AviVahl & @​fabb)

Compatibility notes:

... (truncated)

Commits
  • a9a8e40 v4.7.7
  • e66aed5 Update release notes
  • 7d4d170 disable IE in Saucelabs tests
  • eb860c0 fix weird error in integration tests
  • b6d3de7 fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736)
  • f058970 fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736)
  • 77825f8 refator: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683)
  • 3789a30 chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13
  • e6ad93e v4.7.6
  • 2bf4fc6 Update release notes
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: Mixin without template/render fn results in warning(s)
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/ndresx/vuejs-mixin-no-template-warn](https://github.com/ndresx/vuejs-mixin-no-template-warn)







### Steps to reproduce
1. `npm run serve` (app starts normally without any warnings being shown)
2. Change `Mixin.vue` (e.g., change the console.log message)
3. Warning gets shown `"[Vue warn]: Failed to mount component: template or render function not defined."` on every change

### What is expected?
No warnings about failed mounting attempts as it seems to be workings without a template or render function. Also, the mixin-related examples in the official documentation don't use templates, so there shouldn't be a warning like this at all. Otherwise, it should be already shown when the app gets bootstrapped and not only on subsequent file changes.

### What is actually happening?
I'm not sure, but this behavior and warning logs seem to be inconsistent with this error message. It should be either shown all the time or never.

_Edit: Renaming the mixin's file extension to `.js/.ts` (instead of `.vue`) has solved the issue, and the warning doesn't get shown anymore. However, it's still confusing, in my opinion, that it doesn't get logged right away and only after a change since the mixin's functionality doesn't seem to be directly affected by this._

_It might be worth also adding a note about this to the documentation unless I have missed it._

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mixin without template/render fn results in warning(s)" (#11944)

Issues.Title: Dep collection not paused during first invocation of immediate watchers, leading to unnecessary re-render
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/gyejmL14/32/](https://jsfiddle.net/gyejmL14/32/)

### Steps to reproduce
Press the button "change value of testKey".

### What is expected?
No components should be updated

### What is actually happening?
The root components render function is being run again.

During component-a's creation, the immediate watcher for testKey is invoked without a pushTarget(). At this point the updateComponent() of the parent is still the Dep.target. Everything accessed within the immediate watcher is then collected as a dependency of the parents updateComponent watcher. When the button is then pressed, this triggers an unnecessary update of the Root component.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dep collection not paused during first invocation of immediate watchers, leading to unnecessary re-render" (#11942)

Issues.Title: Route information not shown correctly at App level
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-router-demo-forked-ptgsn?file=/router/index.js](https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-router-demo-forked-ptgsn?file=/router/index.js)







### Steps to reproduce
Browse to https://ptgsn.csb.app/sign-in and open the console. Check the logs for APP: {$route}, LAYOUT: {$route} and PAGE: {$route}
---------------------
APP: 
```
{name: null, meta: Object, path: "/", hash: "", query: Object…}
```

PAGE: 
```
{name: "sign-in", meta: Object, path: "/sign-in", hash: "", query: Object…}
```

LAYOUT: 
```
{name: "sign-in", meta: Object, path: "/sign-in", hash: "", query: Object…}
```

### What is expected?
APP, LAYOUT and PAGE should return the same $route information.


### What is actually happening?
APP returns a null $route

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: How to get the props value after route update (beforeRouteUpdate)
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/os5znjd4/1/](https://jsfiddle.net/os5znjd4/1/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. After clicking 1 and then 2 and viewing the console print, the output of `this.id` is still 1, but 2 is displayed on the page. 

2. Click 3 again to view the console print, `this.id` is output as 2 and the page is displayed as 3.

### What is expected?
The value of `this.id` is the same as the value displayed on the page

### What is actually happening?
The two are not the same, `this.id` is not refreshed immediately after next()

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: How to get the props value after route update (beforeRouteUpdate)
Issues.Body:
The `next()` method is used in the beforeRouteUpdate function, and the value of the `props` of the instance has not changed.

But if I jump to a page with the same route, the beforeRouteUpdate function will be called again. At this time, the props value in the from parameter is the updated value.

But I did not update the props value in the from routing page, I think it should be automatically updated by VueRouter.

So my doubt is, why can't I get this updated value?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to get the props value after route update (beforeRouteUpdate)" (#3492)

Issues.Title: Please enter dot notation support for named routes
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->

Here is a piece of code

```
{ 
 path: '/user/products', 
 name: 'products', 
 component: () => import('../views/user/products/Products.vue'), 
 children: [
   { 
     path: 'list', 
     name: 'list', 
     components: {
     default: () => import('../views/user/products/Products.vue'), 
     products: () => import('../views/user/products/List.vue')
    },
    add...,
    edit...
   },
 ]
},
```

It would just be cool if in a template, I could use it like this

```
<router-link :to="{ name: 'products' }">user products</router-link>
<router-link :to="{ name: 'products.list' }">list</router-link>
<router-link :to="{ name: 'products.add' }">add</router-link>
<router-link :to="{ name: 'products.edit' }">edit</router-link>
```

it was a simple, concise solution, don't you think?

```
<router-link :to="{ name: 'user.products.list' }">user</router-link>
<router-link :to="{ name: 'admin.products.list' }">admin</router-link>
```

???
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Please enter dot notation support for named routes" (#3491)

Issues.Title: It's seems to be an ambiguous statement by "Note: this feature only works if the browser supports history.pushState." on document
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[https://router.vuejs.org/guide/advanced/scroll-behavior.html](https://router.vuejs.org/guide/advanced/scroll-behavior.html)







### Steps to reproduce
open link: https://router.vuejs.org/guide/advanced/scroll-behavior.html

### What is expected?
scroll-behavior only run on `mode: history`

### What is actually happening?
scroll-behavior is not working in `mode: hash` even support `history.pushState` in my browser

---
I often mistakenly think that support `history.pushState` means that the browser supports this attribute. As everyone knows, it means the mode: history mode is used.

Issues.Title: [Feaure Request] Reload component when navigating among pages rendered by a same component
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Suppose there is a route:
```
{
      path: '/user/:id',
      name: 'userHome',
      component: () => import('./views/user/Home'),
      props: true
    },
```
When navigating from page '/user/1' to page '/user/2', the page is not updated for the rendering component is the same and vue router will not reload it.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Reload the component when any of the route's params changed.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页，打开页面后，不能回退到首页。同样的代码，浏览器中正常
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle/无](http://jsfiddle/无)







### Steps to reproduce
1、android webview中使用loadDataWithBaseURL打开首页index.html，router采用hash模式；
2、在首页index.html的created函数中，使用router.push打开一个页面A，OK；
3、在A中，点击按钮后，使用router.push打开一个页面B，在B中点击按钮，调用router.back或go(-1)，无法返回，提示Not allowed to navigate top frame to data URL: data:text/html;charset=utf-8;charset=utf-8;base64,#/；
4、如果使用history模式，返回后呈现空白页。
试过再加一重跳转，index.html->A->B->C，都无法返回，日志提示是一样的。
### What is expected?
返回页面A

### What is actually happening?
页面无变化，日志中提示Not allowed to navigate top frame to data URL: data:text/html;charset=utf-8;charset=utf-8;base64,#/；
source: http://app.njhx.com/assets/builtin/vue-router-src_3.5.1.js (1994)
应该是这一行，window.location[replace ? 'replace' : 'assign'](url);

---
我猜测可能因为loadDataWithBaseURL，index.html是data url，所以不能返回，
但是进入index.html后，就立刻router.push(A)了，按理在B中调用router.back()时，应该回到A才对。

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Vuex - watch option in definition - WHY?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Please do not close this without looking through ALL the links below.

People have asked, but as far as I have read and looked through discussion forums, no one has actually given an answer.

You'll notice that discussions just get closed but always without an answer or meaningful discussion,

https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/1951  
I ask "why this isn't part of the Vuex API", and the answer was "look at #1219". Closed.

Great, I'll take a look!  
https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/1219  
@ralphchristianeclipse asked in 2018, the answer was a question, "What's the practical use case". My answer to that would be it would make Vuex significantly more developer-friendly and make a significantly better developer experience. Which is the reason why Vue was created in the first place - to create a approachable/developer-friendly way to build user interfaces. A bunch of people agreed that the feature would be a good thing. Closed.

https://forum.vuejs.org/t/is-it-possible-to-declare-a-watcher-inside-a-vuex-store/50375  
@mikepatton75 asks if it's possible. The answer is no. Then a bunch of talk about his use-case which didn't need to happen if Vuex just had a watch option, right? Either way, there is no discussion as to WHY the feature isn't available in the Vuex API. So, that's a dead-end as well.

https://forum.vuejs.org/t/vuex-can-i-use-watch-feature-inside-a-vuex-module/75633  
@lwxbr says he does an "extensive workaround" to make a watcher in a store for his use-case, then opens an issue.  But, all he needed was a just simple watcher, right?

https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/1624  
@lwxbr opens the issue. Closed with reference back to #1219 that didn't have an answer.

https://forum.vuejs.org/t/can-a-vuex-module-register-a-watcher-to-watch-its-local-state/8003  
@jri asks if a store can watch its own state, but with an obscurely worded question about a circular file import that is pretty easy to fix with using a 3rd file. But, it never got answered, probably because the question was too obscure? But, perhaps the reason why it was obscure was probably because @jri just needed a simple watcher, but didn't have it, so it was hard to explain the problem in the first place.


### What does the proposed API look like?
Plenty of people have already done this and have been ignored. So, that has proven to be unproductive. I'm simply asking a question "why" and am requesting an answer and/or productive discussion about it so that developers who have the same thought in the future have a productive place to look and understand why Vuex doesn't have a watch option.

Ideally, I'd like to hear from a creator of Vuex with in-depth knowledge about Vuex/Vue as well as the philosophies behind them.

Please do not give just a random answer like, "it's not necessary" because, don't forget, Vue "isn't necessary" either. Let's all use Vanilla! 

I myself am a creator of a UI framework that I designed for beginner developers to learn JavaScript while also making UI frameworks easier to learn later on down the road. I've even taught Vue+Vuex to an entire development team at a company. So, I know how important the core philosophy of a library is.

I have utmost respect for the developers of Vue and Vuex for making such incredible libraries, and I would hope to have that respect reciprocated with an actual productive discussion into this core feature.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Issue with map* with Vuex4, Vue3
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.0

### Reproduction link
[https://gitlab.com/engineertdog/vuex-demo-bug](https://gitlab.com/engineertdog/vuex-demo-bug)







### Steps to reproduce
Clone the repo and run. I've included code for the working and non-working portions.

### What is expected?
I would expect that the map* methods in Vuex4 can be utilized in a computed method so that the get/set methods properly execute getters/setters from the store.

While I am using Quasar, as noticed in the simplified demo, using the function returned from mapGetters inside a computed property does not work and throws errors. The same goes for mapActions when used in conjunction with the set function of the computed property.

However, the functions returned from map* work just fine when used inside of the html template.

### What is actually happening?
When using functions returned from map* functions in Vuex4 inside of computed properties (get or set), errors are thrown. The biggest issues seems to be that $this is undefined, but this happens regardless of whether or not arrow functions are used in the computed property.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Is possible to intercept the dispatcher?
Issues.Body:
In my project currently I have around of 400 dispatch and I saw that the big part of that implementation has the same code: 

```
this.$store.dispatch('action', this.payload).catch(e => {
   console.log(e)
    this.$notify.error(e.message)
})
```

So in order to reduce that code I'd like to intercept the dispatcher to throw the error once, and remove the extra code but I'm not sure if it's possible to do that. So just let me know if it's possible or there any other way to do it.

Thanks in advance.

Issues.Title: Private Mutations
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I am faced with the problem that I have a change in state that might cause that state to become inconsistent. Let's say I have a city name and a zip code in my state. I do not want to change the zip code if the city is not within the area of that zip code. If I do that in a mutation I have no way to reject that change or to catch an error. However if I do it in an action I still need a mutation since actions cannot modify the state directly. Now my colleague is new to our huge project and doesn't notice that one must use the action instead of the mutation and causes the state to become inconsistent. Hence I propose mutations that may only be called from an action. This would enable developers to restrict changes in state to only non-breaking changes.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Since I use TypeScript the obvious way to do it seems a decorator. However to maintain consistency with the api and to be pure js compatible one might introduce a whole different category (e.g. "setters"). If backward compatibility were not an issue this may also become the default behavior as use-cases for mutations directly in components are rare anyhow, since most data needs validation. 
![Infographic from the official documentation](https://vuex.vuejs.org/vuex.png)

This infographic at  seems to imply this also. However these are just proposals off the top of my head and any implementation would need careful consideration as they would deeply impact the vuex api.

### What is expected?
data from Vuex obtained through Computed can be correctly retrieved during onUnmounted



### What is actually happening?
The data in Vuex obtained through computed onUnmounted is undefined

Issues.Title: Immutable references state properties should NOT warn of `do not mutate vuex store state outside mutation handlers.`
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
In a lot of contexts, we want to store _reference_ of objects in the store that come from a _library_. 
This means that the reference come from _outside_ the store and is managed (mutated) outside of the store too.

Vuex will by default, rightfully throw a warning because the object is mutated oustide of the store mutations.
However in some cases it is useful to store such references in the stores as _immutable references_, in order to persists them and to use them through getters and actions.
The warning should _not_ be thrown IF and only IF the reference is Immutable. The only known way of ensuring this is to wrap the reference with this Type: 
```Typescript
type Immutable<T> = {
  readonly [K in keyof T]: Immutable<T[K]>;
};
```

for example the state could have a [tiptap](https://github.com/ueberdosis/tiptap) Editor reference:
```Typescript 
editor!: Immutable<Editor> = getTipTapEditorInstance();
```

Where the Editor properties setting is managed by the library.
Which is a much needed pattern.


### What does the proposed API look like?
Vuex needs either to propose an Annotation that we would put above the immutable reference declaration in order to silence the warning *just* for this reference.
OR to detect at runtime to not throw the warning if all keys of the object are immutable/const
OR to detect if the reference is wrapped by the type Immutable<T>, type which could be provided by Vuex or even Vue.ts because it is generally useful

Issues.Title: fix: Add optional to getter arguments
Issues.Body:
As mentioned in: https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/1467 

Just making sure the arguments on getters are aligned with the actual usage, otherwise any typescript user is enquire to pass all arguments even if they are not really required:

Example:
`getters.bar(state, getters, state, {})` => `getters.bar(state)` works equally for Vuex module level
